With flash memory storage, I can transport support points manually and permanently, but these are hardly suitable for automated storage. I connected several flash memory units and a management system to a Flash Server.

This storage unit can be used as a destination, source, or buffer, depending on the setting. I have provided internal connections for loading/unloading by hand as well as for a permanent increase in capacity (4 slots).
The Flash Server will be especially important in more modern systems because I simply cannot provide all machines with a unit for reading flash memory.
Note: The block can be set as support output or support input with the "Logistics Editor".
